About Me

As a passionate Cloud Native Engineer, I am on a continuous journey to expand my expertise in the landscape of cloud computing and DevOps.

My professional goal is to tackle increasingly challenges within these ﬁelds with a focus on harnessing the latest technologies to architect resilient, scalable, and eﬃcient cloud-native solutions, aiming to contribute to the advancement of these ﬁelds.

Projects

Multi-Cluster Communication with Service Mesh

https://github.com/Saifweb

Implemented multi-cluster communication spanning multiple cloud providers with advanced traffic management using Istio.

  • Use Terraform modules and Terragrunt layers to provision your EKS, AKS, and K3s Kubernetes clusters on Equinix bare metal servers.
  • Integrate provisioned clusters with Rancher for centralized management.
  • Install Istio on each of the three clusters and ensure multicluster communication spanning multiple networks.
  • Configure Istio’s mTLS to ensure secure communication between services in all clusters.
  • Create a Helm chart that defines the demo application you want to deploy. This chart includes the application deployment, services, and other necessary Kubernetes resources.
  • Deploy the helm chart using argocd deployed on primary cluster. - Utilize Istio for advanced traffic management. Define VirtualServices and Gateway resources to control how traffic is routed and load balanced across clusters.
  • Configure Istio to implement fine-grained authorization and authentication policies to secure traffic between clusters. - Visualize the mesh using Kiali and collect metrics and traces with Grafana and Jaeger.
  • Deploy Istio Ingress Gateway in each cluster to expose your application externally over HTTPS.
  • Building CI/CD pipeline containing stages, jobs and dependencies to automate the process.
